identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Angong Niuhuang Wan for Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Chinese Medicine Angong Niuhuang Wan for the Treatment of the Stroke: A Randomized, Double-blind,Placebo Controlled Clinical Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of using Chinese Medicine Angong Niuhuang Wan in stroke patients, the modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score will be used as primary outcome, the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score, The Modified Barthel Index (MBI) score and the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) scores will be used as secondary outcome measures.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This study is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial which is used to further determine the effectiveness of Angong Niuhuang Wan in treating stroke patients on top of the standard conventional treatment, also to evaluate the improvement level on quality of life of post-stroke after using Angong Niuhuang Wan. The effect of Angong Niuhuang Wan on liver and kidney function will be focused and using NMR techniques to analysis metabolomics to further study the safety and effectiveness of Angong Niuhuang Wan on the prevention and treatment of stroke.

It is a 24-week trial, Double-blind treatment for 1 week, follow up visit for 23 weeks. All participant will have study blood taking for renal and liver function test and questionnaires assessment during study visits. Informed consent will be obtained before study enrollment.

armGroups.label: Treatment Group
armGroups.description: Chinese Medicine of Angong Niuhuang Wan

primaryOutcomes.measure: Score of neurological deficit and adverse events
primaryOutcomes.description: compare the therapeutic effects, the score of neurological deficit and adverse events between the two groups by using questionnaire of mRS, higher scores mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mortality and recurrence rates of stroke
secondaryOutcomes.description: Compare the mortality and recurrence rates of stroke between two groups also the abilities of daily ability using questionnaires of NIHSS (higher scores mean a worse outcome), mBI and MOCA-HK (higher scores mean a better outcome)

locations.facility: The Chinese University of Hong Kong
